sources.title: Range Riders (1934) BUDDY ROOSEVELT
sources.description:
Cast: Buddy Roosevelt, Barbara Starr, Lew Meehan
Director: Denver Dixon

An elderly rancher writes to his college-attending son to come home and help him battle bandits that are trying to take over his ranch.

metadata.Plot: An outlaw gang is terrorizing the town and local ranchers, so old John Sutton sends a letter to his college-attending son, Dick, to come home and take care of the varmits. Gang leader "Bull" Crawford and his motley crew of henchmen make plans to meet Dick when he arrives. The man they meet is a sappy-looking young man who arrives loaded down with tennis racquets, golf clubs, butterfly nets and other paraphernalia the outlaws associate with saps, boobs and broke-back tap dancers. They figure they have nothing to fear from old "Dad" Sutton's pride and joy. Rancher's daughter Elsie Waldron doesn't think so, either.
metadata.Actors: Buddy Roosevelt, Barbara Starr, Lew Meehan
